meanings.definition: To clear from accusation or blame.
meanings.sent1: The new evidence was crucial in exonerating the suspect.
meanings.sent2: The judge exonerated the defendant after the real culprit confessed.
meanings.sent3: The detective's clever investigation led to exonerating the wrongfully accused man.
meanings.sent4: The truth finally came out, exonerating the innocent bystander.
meanings.sent5: The DNA test results were the key to exonerating the wrongly convicted individual.

meanings.definition: To free from guilt or responsibility.
meanings.sent1: The apology helped in exonerating him from any wrongdoing.
meanings.sent2: The pardon from the governor exonerated the prisoner.
meanings.sent3: Eating the last cookie and blaming the dog was his way of exonerating himself.
meanings.sent4: The supportive friend's words acted as a shield, exonerating her from self-doubt.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt confession was the first step in exonerating himself from the guilt.
